titleStmt.title: Tidt er jeg glad, og vil dog gerne græde

work.title: Tidt er jeg glad, og vil dog gerne græde
Oft am I glad, still may I weep from sadness
Tit er jeg glad, og vil dog gerne græde

history.p: The exact date of composition is unknown; from surviving letters, however, it is clear that Nielsen was engaged with the text and probably also with the music during July 1916.

bibl.author: Anne-Marie Reynolds
bibl.title: Carl Nielsen's 'Folk-like' Songs and the 'Danish National Tone'
Carl Nielsen Studies

bibl.label: Barndom
bibl.author: Anne-Marie Reynolds
bibl.title: Carl Nielsen's Voice. His Songs in Context

incipText.p: Tidt er jeg glad, og vil dog gerne græde
Oft am I glad, still may I weep from sadness

titlePage.p: Carl Nielsen / og / Thomas Laub / En Snes danske Viser / 1917 / 2 den Samling / FORLÆGGERENS EJENDOM FOR ALLE LANDE. / KJØBENHAVN & LEIPZIG. / WILHELM HANSEN, MUSIK-FORLAG / Copyright 1917 by Wilhelm Hansen, Leipzig.

annot.p: Letter of 20 July 1916 from Carl Nielsen to Thorvald Aagaard
Letter of 17 Sep. 1916 from Carl Nielsen to Thorvald Aagaard
Printed in: A.P. Berggreen, Compositioner for Sang og Claveer.
